item.title: Icarus PS5 and Xbox Series X|S Release Date Revealed for Late February
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Rocketwerkz has announced a release date for planetary survival game Icarus on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, and you won't have to wait much longer to try the game outside of its PC home.

Icarus is officially arriving on consoles on February 26th, with console publishing duties being handled by Grip Studios, a support outfit that's worked on the likes of Mafia: The Old Country and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, among other games.

The console version of Icarus will include not only the base game, but also its New Frontiers expansion, which brings a massive extra region to explore, plus lots of new enemies, workshop items, and more.

What's more, if you pre-order Icarus on PS5 or Xbox Series X|S, you'll get access to the Pet Companions Pack DLC, which, as the name suggests, adds a number of adorable animals to pet and look after.

News of Icarus' console release date comes just a couple of weeks after Rocketwerkz and founder Dean Hall announced that the game had managed to rack up almost a million sales for itself during the most recent winter Steam Sale.

Hall also said that Icarus had managed to shift just shy of 250,000 "DLC units", although since the game has a number of smaller packs available in addition to its major expansion, that could just mean a whole bunch of what are effectively microtransaction purchases.

Just in case you're unfamiliar, Icarus is a survival game created by Dean Hall, one of the key players behind zombie sandbox DayZ. It's a PvE-focused affair that sees you (and, optionally, your squad) heading down to a planet on which terraforming has gone wrong and trying to survive its dangers.

You can check out Icarus right now on PC, and it's coming to PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S on February 26th. Stay tuned for more.

item.title: Phasmophobia Roadmap for 2026 Highlights 1.0 Launch, New Maps, and More
item.content:encoded:
Developer and publisher Kinetic Games has revealed the 2026 roadmap for Phasmophobia, and it looks forward to major events like the game's 1.0 release, its Switch 2 launch, and more.

Per a press release, major updates coming to Phasmophobia throughout 2026 include a character overhaul, an update for the game's Unity engine, and a release for Nintendo's Switch 2, as well as the full 1.0 release, which will be accompanied by a "horror rework and lore update".

When it comes to maps, you can look forward to reworks for the Tanglewood and Willow locations, as well as a brand new map that Kinetic is still keeping close to its chest for now.

Of course, Phasmophobia also has plenty of events planned throughout 2026, including a brand new one-time event and the return of old favorites like Cursed Hollow, Crimson Eye, and Winter's Jest.

Phasmophobia director Daniel Knight says he's hoping that the 1.0 release of Phasmophobia, which still doesn't have a date attached to it, will "feel as fresh and exciting as when the game first launched back in 2020". We can but hope.

If you're not familiar with Phasmophobia, it's a multiplayer-focused ghost-hunting game in which your goal is to enter haunted locations and document the phenomena that can be found within.

Each ghost type has a different method of identification attached to it, so you'll have to enter the location, discover what you're dealing with it, and grab evidence along the way.

Originally released for PC in 2020, Phasmophobia also launched on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S in 2024, following numerous delays. The game went on to sell over three million copies on console alone, so it's safe to say this one has been a success.

Indeed, the revenue from Phasmophobia has helped Kinetic Games to open up its own publishing division, which will champion indie games that just need a little extra push to get over the finish line.

Phasmophobia is available right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Stay tuned for more.
